Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Spank \Spank\ (sp[a^][ng]k), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Spanked} (sp[a^][ng]kt); p. pr. & vb. n. {Spanking}.] [Of unknown origin; cf. LG. spakken, spenkern, to run and spring about quickly.] To strike, as the breech, with the open hand; to slap. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Spank \Spank\, n. A blow with the open hand; a slap. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Spank \Spank\, v. i. To move with a quick, lively step between a trot and gallop; to move quickly. --Thackeray. [1913 Webster]
spank n : a slap with the flat of the hand v : give a spanking to; subject to a spanking [syn: {paddle}, {larrup}]
